original: rol dang rtse dang // sgeg pa la //

original: by'a la / ma rungs //

original: chom rkun sman //

analyzed: shog shing me tog khyad par la //

analyzed: bye brag sh'a ra //

analyzed: lcang ma dang ni tam ti sa //

analyzed: bi d'a la byi la //

analyzed: gting zab ri bo nub ri la //

analyzed: si ma l'a ni dri med bsil //

original: sa yi dbye ba dag la yang //
analyzed: sa yi dbye ba dag la yang //

analyzed: bi shul ni shing dbye dang // yangs pa dang ni rgya che la //

analyzed: @228b bi sh'a la ni dbang mchog skyes //

analyzed: ka bi snyan dngags mkhan po dang // ba ba sangs dang grog mkhar dang // khyi dang snyan dngags byed pa la //

analyzed: skye bo dang ni rnam gnon la //

analyzed: kharba thung ngu dang ni dri //

analyzed: gr'i ba mgrin pa //

original: mgul pa la //
analyzed: mgul pa la //

analyzed: mchog bdag la'o nga ba ni //

analyzed: nags dang nags tshal //

analyzed: nags klung la //

analyzed: di bam mtho ris bar snang dang // 'od 'gro //

analyzed: gnamdang / mkha' la'o //

analyzed: de ba // rgyal po lha dang sprin //

analyzed: gzi brjid can ma prikka dang // gar mar tshangs pas dbang bskur dang / mi yi bdag po'i bud med la //

analyzed: rnam par zhu bar gyur pa la //

analyzed: dvandvam log par spyod pa la /

analyzed: ba ta / nor //

analyzed: n'i b'i / sked pa'i gos mdud pa //

analyzed: rtsa ba dang ni tha ma la //

analyzed: marshva mchan khung gzhi dang ni //

analyzed: pri th'i sa gzhi sa dang ni /

analyzed: bla ba / k'a randa ba dang // sbal pa dang ni /

original: bhe la ka //
analyzed: bhe la ka //

original: chu yi bya rog pla ksha'i shing //
analyzed: chu yi bya rog pla ksha'i shing //

analyzed: ring du 'gro dang // sgra gding ba //

analyzed: bha ba / dpal mgrin 'khor ba dang // dpal dang // legs 'thob skye ba la //

analyzed: / skye bo //

analyzed: sgo dang chu //

translated: in the infinite, in the unwholesome, in elephants, in fingers,

original: dzi g'i sha ni rgyal 'dod dang // cung zad rgod pa dag dang ni //
analyzed: dzi g'i sha ni rgyal 'dod dang // cung zad rgod pa dag dang ni //
translated: The word jīva is used for one who desires to be king, for one who is a little bit agitated,

original: phul du byung dang mtha' la'o //
analyzed: phul du byung dang mtha' la'o //
translated: and for excellent and final.

original: ta r'i sha ni dbyibs mdzes dang // bhe la chu gter mtha' la'o //
analyzed: ta r'i sha ni dbyibs mdzes dang // bhe la chu gter mtha' la'o //
translated: The word taru is used for one who has a beautiful form, and for the ocean’s end.

original: t'i bi sha ni gser dang sprin //
analyzed: t'i bi sha ni gser dang sprin //
translated: The word tīvīśa is used for gold and clouds.🔽The word naghūṣa is used for a king’s proclamation,

original: na ghu sha ni rgyal dbye dang ; / sprul gyi bye brag dag la'ang //
analyzed: na ghu sha ni rgyal dbye dang ; / sprul gyi bye brag dag la'ang //
translated: and for a particular kind of snake.

original: ni sha ka /
analyzed: ni sha ka /
translated: niśāka

original: karsha p'a na //
analyzed: karsha p'a na //
translated: karṣāpaṇa

original: ni ka sh'a ni rgya skye gas ma //
analyzed: ni ka sh'a ni rgya skye gas ma //
translated: nikāśa is used for a lotus.

original: ni me sha ni mig 'dzums dang // dus dbye dang ni mig 'dres la //
analyzed: ni me sha ni mig 'dzums dang // dus dbye dang ni mig 'dres la //
translated: The word nimeṣa is used for winking, for a division of time, and for a mixture of eyes.

original: ba ru sham ni bkra brtsub //
analyzed: ba ru sham ni bkra brtsub //
translated: The word varuṣa is used for a variegated and rough

original: bab chol rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bab chol rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: and for one who speaks nonsense.

original: pu ru sha ni klu shing dang // sbrang rtsi skyes dang mchog dag la //
analyzed: pu ru sha ni klu shing dang // sbrang rtsi skyes dang mchog dag la //
translated: The word puruṣa is used for a nāga tree, for honey, and for the best.

original: soo ru sham ni gzi brjid dang // bsam pa dang ni las la yang //🔽steng dang / rgya chen dpung pa dang // lag pa mi dang btung ba la //
analyzed: soo ru sham ni gzi brjid dang // bsam pa dang ni las la yang // steng dang / rgya chen dpung pa dang // lag pa mi dang btung ba la //
translated: The word sauvarṣa is used for splendor, for intention, and for action.

original: pra ty'u sha ni nyin mo'i sgo //
analyzed: pra ty'u sha ni nyin mo'i sgo //
translated: The word pratyūṣa is used for the door of the day,

original: tho rangs dang ni nor lha'o //
analyzed: tho rangs dang ni nor lha'o //
translated: for dawn, and for the god of wealth.

original: pra do sha ni skyon ldan ma //
analyzed: pra do sha ni skyon ldan ma //
translated: The Pradosha is the one with a fault.🔽

original: srod dang mtshan mo'i sgo la'o ;
analyzed: srod dang mtshan mo'i sgo la'o ;
translated: Pradosha is the evening.

original: / ma hi sh'i ni sa skyong gi / btsun mor dbang bskur byin la'o //
analyzed: / ma hi sh'i ni sa skyong gi / btsun mor dbang bskur byin la'o //
translated: Mahiśī is the consecration of a queen.🔽Māriśā is the nurse who distinguishes the fragrant

original: m'a ri sh'a ni dri zhim dang // sman dbye gsal ba'i ma ma'o //
analyzed: m'a ri sh'a ni dri zhim dang // sman dbye gsal ba'i ma ma'o //
translated: and the medicinal.

original: m'a ri sha ni sdo'i dbye ba //
analyzed: m'a ri sha ni sdo'i dbye ba //
translated: Māriśā is the division of the herbs.

original: gar ma dang ni 'gyur byed ma'o //
analyzed: gar ma dang ni 'gyur byed ma'o //
translated: It is the dancer and the one who changes.

original: ro hi sham ni gtsang byed nya //
analyzed: ro hi sham ni gtsang byed nya //
translated: Rohīśa is the one who purifies.

original: ro hi sha ni ri dags dbye //🔽bi she sha ni dbye ba tsam ;
analyzed: ro hi sha ni ri dags dbye // bi she sha ni dbye ba tsam ;
translated: Rohīśa is the division of the deer.🔽Viśeṣa is merely a division.

original: / bi she sha ni thig le la //
analyzed: / bi she sha ni thig le la //
translated: Viśeṣa is the drop.

original: be shle sha ni ma 'byer dang // kha bral ba dang ring du gyur //
analyzed: be shle sha ni ma 'byer dang // kha bral ba dang ring du gyur //
translated: Veśeṣa is the non-separation, the separation, and the distance.

original: by'a karsha ni snying po can //
analyzed: by'a karsha ni snying po can //
translated: Vyākṛṣṭa is the essence.

original: sa la ka dang rgyan 'gyed 'gugs //
analyzed: sa la ka dang rgyan 'gyed 'gugs //
translated: Salaka and vyāghrāṅkuśa are the dice and the dice throw.

original: shu shru sha ni nyan 'dod dang // bsnyen bkur dang ni gtam dag la //
analyzed: shu shru sha ni nyan 'dod dang // bsnyen bkur dang ni gtam dag la //
translated: Śuśrūṣā is the desire to listen, the service, and the conversation.

original: shee lu sha ni bil ba'i shing //
analyzed: shee lu sha ni bil ba'i shing //
translated: Śailuṣa is the bilva tree.

original: ku sh'i @234b gcod pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: ku sh'i @234b gcod pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also the cutting of the kuśa grass.

original: sam harsha ni 'gran pa dang // aa nu karsha shing rta yi //
analyzed: sam harsha ni 'gran pa dang // aa nu karsha shing rta yi //
translated: Samharṣa is the competition, and anukarṣa is the chariot.

original: 'og shing dang ni rjes su 'gugs //
analyzed: 'og shing dang ni rjes su 'gugs //
translated: [The word] adhara [means] 'wood' and 'to draw after'.

original: lha yi btung bsred pa dang // mngon par 'dod pa dag la'o //
analyzed: lha yi btung bsred pa dang // mngon par 'dod pa dag la'o //
translated: [The word] devapāna [means] 'to desire' and 'to long for'.

original: aa rdzi mi sha lha dang nya //
analyzed: aa rdzi mi sha lha dang nya //
translated: [The word] arjimiśa [means] 'god' and 'fish'.

original: aamba ri sha ri'i bye brag / nyi ma dgra sta dum bu can //
analyzed: aamba ri sha ri'i bye brag / nyi ma dgra sta dum bu can //
translated: [The word] ambarīśa [means] 'a particular mountain' and 'the sun'.

original: p'i ta na dang ; ki sho ra //
analyzed: p'i ta na dang ; ki sho ra //
translated: [The word] paṭaṇa [means] 'a banner' and 'a flag'.

original: aa mbu r'i sham sgra yul 'khor //🔽aa lambu sha /🔽skyug byed la //
analyzed: aa mbu r'i sham sgra yul 'khor // aa lambu sha / skyug byed la //
translated: [The word] ambarīśa [means] 'sound' and 'a country'.

original: aa lambu sh'a gandi r'i //
analyzed: aa lambu sh'a gandi r'i //
translated: [The word] alambuśa [means] 'vomit' and 'to vomit'.

original: mtho ris dang ni rje rigs dang // kimbu ru sha lta gdong can //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ni rje rigs dang // kimbu ru sha lta gdong can //
translated: [The word] alambuśagandharī [means] 'heaven' and 'nobility'.

original: 'jig rten dbye ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbye ba la yang ngo //
translated: [The word] kimburusha [means] 'face' and 'to divide the world'.

original: nandi gho sha pha rol gnas //🔽bstod pa 'don pa dbyangs byed pa //
analyzed: nandi gho sha pha rol gnas // bstod pa 'don pa dbyangs byed pa //
translated: [The word] nandīghoṣa [means] 'the other shore' and 'to cross over'.🔽[The word] parīghoṣa [means] 'to praise' and 'to sing'.

original: pa ri gho sha brjod bya dang // nges par sgrogs dang 'brug sgra la //🔽pa lam bzang bza ma dang // rgya skyegs gu gul kim shu ka //
analyzed: pa ri gho sha brjod bya dang // nges par sgrogs dang 'brug sgra la // pa lam bzang bza ma dang // rgya skyegs gu gul kim shu ka //
translated: [The word] nādī [means] 'to proclaim' and 'thunder'.🔽[The word] palam [means] 'good food' and 'good to eat'.

original: pa lam ka sha ma go zlum dang // sman dang srin po nyid la'o //
analyzed: pa lam ka sha ma go zlum dang // sman dang srin po nyid la'o //
translated: [The word] palam [means] 'lac', 'agalloch', 'kimshuka', 'medicine', and 'rākṣasa'.

original: ma h'a gho sh'a rva yi dbye //
analyzed: ma h'a gho sh'a rva yi dbye //
translated: [The word] mahāghoṣa [means] 'a horn' and 'a division'.

original: tshong dus kyis ni glag cor la //🔽b'a ta ra r'u sha /
analyzed: tshong dus kyis ni glag cor la // b'a ta ra r'u sha /
translated: [The syllable] sa is the marketplace, the cry of the hawk,🔽and the wind.

original: rlung tshub dang// skra 'greng pa dang brgya byin gzhu //
analyzed: rlung tshub dang// skra 'greng pa dang brgya byin gzhu //
translated: [The syllable] sa is also the hair standing on end, Indra's bow,

original: sha mtha'i sde'o /
analyzed: sha mtha'i sde'o /
translated: and the end of flesh.

original: // / s'a na don dad dpal la'o //
analyzed: // / s'a na don dad dpal la'o //
translated: [The syllable] sa is the meaning of wealth and glory.

original: s'i ni kha lo sgyur ba la //
analyzed: s'i ni kha lo sgyur ba la //
translated: [The syllable] si is the charioteer of the earth.

original: se ni dpal mo'i bu dang dga' //🔽so ni skems byed ma ma la //
analyzed: se ni dpal mo'i bu dang dga' // so ni skems byed ma ma la //
translated: [The syllable] su is the son of Sri and joy.🔽[The syllable] so is the one who dries up and the mother.

original: aam sa cha dang 'ching ba la //
analyzed: aam sa cha dang 'ching ba la //
translated: [The syllable] sa is the part of the body and binding.

original: k'a su nus pa dang mtshon cha //
analyzed: k'a su nus pa dang mtshon cha //
translated: [The syllable] ka is power and weapon.🔽[The syllable] ka is also incomplete, garment, staff,

original: ma tshang gos dang 'khar ba dang // lha mi 'khar ba dag la'o //
analyzed: ma tshang gos dang 'khar ba dang // lha mi 'khar ba dag la'o //

original: 'khar ba'i snod dang / tshad dang yang //🔽gungba ta pa k'a h'a ra //
analyzed: 'khar ba'i snod dang / tshad dang yang // gungba ta pa k'a h'a ra //
translated: [The syllable] ka is also the vessel and measure.

original: sdong bu / granthi parna la //
analyzed: sdong bu / granthi parna la //
translated: [The syllable] ka is also the stalk,

original: go sa tho rangs po la dag / ts'a sa /
analyzed: go sa tho rangs po la dag / ts'a sa /
translated: and the granthiparna.🔽[The syllable] ca is the time of dawn and the dawn.🔽[The syllable] ca is also gold, the topknot,

original: gser dang gtsug phud dang // rab dbye khru dang tshig rnams la'o //
analyzed: gser dang gtsug phud dang // rab dbye khru dang tshig rnams la'o //

original: dv'a sa nor bu skyon 'jigs pa //🔽d'a sa gla mi nya pa dang ; / dad dang sbyin pa tsam dang ni //
analyzed: dv'a sa nor bu skyon 'jigs pa // d'a sa gla mi nya pa dang ; / dad dang sbyin pa tsam dang ni //
translated: [The syllable] va is the jewel, fault, and fear.🔽[The syllable] da is the hired man, fisherman,🔽and faith and mere giving.

original: bran dang bud pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: bran dang bud pa rnams la'o //
translated: [The syllable] da is also the servant and the slave.

original: n'a sa / sna dang / sna yi sgo //
analyzed: n'a sa / sna dang / sna yi sgo //

original: steng gi shing dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: steng gi shing dag la yang ngo //
translated: Snan-dag, also on the trees.

original: pra s'u ma ma gzhal ba dang // rta dang 'gal ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: pra s'u ma ma gzhal ba dang // rta dang 'gal ba rnams la'o //
translated: Prasū, without a measure, and prasūta, in conflict with a horse.🔽Vasū, glory.

original: ba s'u dpal sbyin bu ga me //
analyzed: ba s'u dpal sbyin bu ga me //
translated: Dāna, giving.🔽Rāja, king.🔽Rāśi, class.🔽Prabhā, light.

original: rigs dang 'od dang lha'i khyad par //
analyzed: rigs dang 'od dang lha'i khyad par //

original: shing dang sman dang rin chen dang // steng dang tshong dus nor dang ni //
analyzed: shing dang sman dang rin chen dang // steng dang tshong dus nor dang ni //

original: snyan ngag khur dang mthu dang mdzes //
analyzed: snyan ngag khur dang mthu dang mdzes //

original: bha se sa yi bya rgod dang // goshto dang ni bya gag la //
analyzed: bha se sa yi bya rgod dang // goshto dang ni bya gag la //

original: mam sam sha dang sbang spos dang // kakko li dang ral pa la //
analyzed: mam sam sha dang sbang spos dang // kakko li dang ral pa la //

original: m'a sa / zla ba mjal byed dang // m'a s'i /🔽sbrang rtsi'o mi si @235a * //🔽ni ; / me tog brgya ba dz'a m'a ni //
analyzed: m'a sa / zla ba mjal byed dang // m'a s'i / sbrang rtsi'o mi si @235a * // ni ; / me tog brgya ba dz'a m'a ni //

original: mri dv'a gnas can sa mchog dang // ra sa /
analyzed: mri dv'a gnas can sa mchog dang // ra sa /
translated: Mṛdvīka, the best place.🔽Rasa, juice.

original: ro bcud / tikt'a sogs //
analyzed: ro bcud / tikt'a sogs //

original: sgog pa sogs dang khu bdug / dngul chu khams dang cha nge //
analyzed: sgog pa sogs dang khu bdug / dngul chu khams dang cha nge //

original: bo la mar dang lus la'o //
analyzed: bo la mar dang lus la'o //

original: ra s'a / lce dang // rta pho dang // 'don dang sha lla k'i kam gu //
analyzed: ra s'a / lce dang // rta pho dang // 'don dang sha lla k'i kam gu //

analyzed: r'a sa gla rtsi rtse ba dang // skad dang lcags sgrog la yang ngo //

analyzed: phat+sa / bu sogs talla ka // tshar ba dang ni za ba la //

original: b'a s'a / khyim dang gnas skabs dang // aa te /
analyzed: b'a s'a / khyim dang gnas skabs dang // aa te /
translated: house, occasion,🔽and the one called ATI.

original: r'ul ka zhes la'o //
analyzed: r'ul ka zhes la'o //
translated: The one called RULAKA.🔽The one called JASA,

original: bya sa thub pa rgya che la //
analyzed: bya sa thub pa rgya che la //
translated: the sage, the extensive,🔽and the one called SHAMSA,

original: sham sa brjod dang 'dod pa la //
analyzed: sham sa brjod dang 'dod pa la //
translated: expression, and desire.🔽The one called HIMSA,

original: him sa chom rkun sogs dang gnod //
analyzed: him sa chom rkun sogs dang gnod //
translated: harm from thieves and so forth.🔽The one called HAMSA,

original: ham sa nyi ma /
analyzed: ham sa nyi ma /
translated: the sun.

original: ma d'a la //
analyzed: ma d'a la //
translated: The one called MADHA,🔽the black one, the body wind,

original: nag po lus kyi rlung dang ni //
analyzed: nag po lus kyi rlung dang ni //
translated: and the one called AVHAYI,🔽the one without attachment, the lord of men, the supreme lord,🔽the divisions of yoga, mantra and so forth,

analyzed: chags med mi bdag mchog gi bdag / rnal 'byor sngags sogs dbye ba dang // ser sna rta yi khyad par la //

analyzed: aa bhy'e sa ni /

original: deng 'di gzhan //
analyzed: deng 'di gzhan //

analyzed: yang dag bzhag dang yon tan dang // phongs dang 'od dang ma lus la //

analyzed: aa li sa ni bya ba dal //

analyzed: rkang nang shing gi khyad par la //

original: aa la s'a ni dad pa'i bdag / rtag 'gro sdig pa gzhan la gnod //
analyzed: aa la s'a ni dad pa'i bdag / rtag 'gro sdig pa gzhan la gnod //
translated: Alasana is the self of faith, always going, and harming others.

original: a'a shis sbrul gyi mche ba dang // gnod pa byed dang mtshungs pa la //
analyzed: a'a shis sbrul gyi mche ba dang // gnod pa byed dang mtshungs pa la //
translated: Ashish is the fangs of a snake, and equal to the one who harms.

original: a'a shv'a sa ni kun bshad dang // yongs su gcod dang nges 'jug / nyi //
analyzed: a'a shv'a sa ni kun bshad dang // yongs su gcod dang nges 'jug / nyi //
translated: Ashvasana is the explanation of all, and the determination of engagement.

original: tstshv'a shv'a sa ni 'ching ba tsam //
analyzed: tstshv'a shv'a sa ni 'ching ba tsam //
translated: Tshvasha is only the binding.

original: g-yo ba dang ni gzhu la'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang ni gzhu la'o //
translated: It is for movement and the bow.

original: autstshva sa ni dbugs rngub dang // dbugs 'byin rkyang pa 'ching ba dang // yon tan gyi ni khyad par la //
analyzed: autstshva sa ni dbugs rngub dang // dbugs 'byin rkyang pa 'ching ba dang // yon tan gyi ni khyad par la //
translated: Utshasana is the binding of only the exhalation and inhalation of breath, and the distinction of qualities.

original: auttam sa ni /🔽rna rgyan dang // rna ba gnag dang thod dkris la //
analyzed: auttam sa ni / rna rgyan dang // rna ba gnag dang thod dkris la //
translated: Uttama is🔽the earring, the black ear, and the turban.

original: au ra sa bong dang sgrib pa la //
analyzed: au ra sa bong dang sgrib pa la //
translated: Ur is the donkey and the obscuration.

original: ru shas / dgongs mthun /
analyzed: ru shas / dgongs mthun /
translated: Rushi is the dawn, the agreement, and the dawn.

original: tho rangs dag / ae nas gzhan dbang sdig pa dang // lus dang khang pa dag la'o //
analyzed: tho rangs dag / ae nas gzhan dbang sdig pa dang // lus dang khang pa dag la'o //
translated: E is the other, the sin, and the body and the house.

original: ao rdzas gzi brjid khams rnams ni //
analyzed: ao rdzas gzi brjid khams rnams ni //
translated: O is the substance, the splendor, and the elements.

original: kun nas brdas dang / rab gsal la //
analyzed: kun nas brdas dang / rab gsal la //
translated: It is the complete sign, and the clear.

original: nye bar 'dzin dang gcod pa'ang //
analyzed: nye bar 'dzin dang gcod pa'ang //
translated: It is also the grasping and the cutting.

original: k'i ka sam ni rus pa la //
analyzed: k'i ka sam ni rus pa la //
translated: Kakasha is the bone.

original: k'i ka sa ni 'bu phran la //
analyzed: k'i ka sa ni 'bu phran la //
translated: kāka means a small insect.

original: tstshanda sa tshigs bcad thos pa 'dod //
analyzed: tstshanda sa tshigs bcad thos pa 'dod //
translated: caṇḍa means a verse, one who desires to hear.

original: rang dbang dang ni kun spyod la //
analyzed: rang dbang dang ni kun spyod la //
translated: ca means independence, conduct.

original: tsa ma sa ni kun 'gro / gser //
analyzed: tsa ma sa ni kun 'gro / gser //
translated: camasa means all-pervading, gold.

original: rgyags dang phyi ma'i dbye ba la //
analyzed: rgyags dang phyi ma'i dbye ba la //
translated: caṇḍa means pride, the division of the future.

original: dzy'a yas / thu bo /🔽phul byung la /
analyzed: dzy'a yas / thu bo / phul byung la /
translated: jyā means the best.

original: dzyo tis / sgra dang me rab gsal //
analyzed: dzyo tis / sgra dang me rab gsal //

analyzed: ma l'i ma sa /

analyzed: sl'a ma dang // lcags dang me tog tshur dag la //

original: go ma la //
analyzed: go ma la //

analyzed: ra se ra sa bcud skyes dang // bcud grub pa dang stobs la'o //

original: pi bh'a ba su /
analyzed: pi bh'a ba su /

analyzed: 'od chen dang // nyi ma 'phrog byed khyad par la //

analyzed: bi sho pa su dri za yi // bye brag dang mi mtshan mo la //

analyzed: bi h'a yas ni mkha' 'gro dang // mkha' dang lha yi lam la'o //

original: sa manydza sa ri mo goms //
analyzed: sa manydza sa ri mo goms //

analyzed: bardza ra sa pe wang gi / rab dbye dang ni dh'u na ka // sadh'i yansa shin tu legs //

original: shin tu ghadta la yang ngo //
analyzed: shin tu ghadta la yang ngo //

analyzed: siddha r'a sa ro bcud dang // sbrul gdug sogs so sum n'a sa //

analyzed: me tog phreng dang brtan dang dbyangs //
translated: The flower garland, firm, and melody [are the names of the nakṣatras].

analyzed: su me dh'a sa ni gsal ldan dang // blo gros bzang po dbang la'o//

analyzed: di bya tsakshus don dang ni //

original: dri bzang dang ni mig mdzes la //
analyzed: dri bzang dang ni mig mdzes la //

analyzed: ham gu nir++y'a sam'i sgra 'di //

analyzed: nimba dang ni shing kun ro //

analyzed: hi ra n+ya ra has zhes pa //

analyzed: me lce bdun dang de nas yang //

analyzed: bdun gyi bdun pa dag la'o //

original: sa mtha'i sde'o /
analyzed: sa mtha'i sde'o /

original: // / ha ni khro mdangs bcas pa yi //
analyzed: // / ha ni khro mdangs bcas pa yi //
translated: The ha [is the name of the nakṣatra] with an angry glare,

original: glang po dang ni rdo rje la //
analyzed: glang po dang ni rdo rje la //

analyzed: hi ni dbang po bu la'o //

original: aa hi lha min /
analyzed: aa hi lha min /

original: bri ta / sprul //
analyzed: bri ta / sprul //

analyzed: a'i h'a grib ma aud++ya ma // au hu zla ba cha nyams dang // mthong ba dang ni /

original: tshogs pa la //
analyzed: tshogs pa la //

analyzed: gu ha / (ras gza' spen pa nas bzlog ste phri ba'i/) tshang tshing /

original: seng ge'i / mjug / phug dang phung po rnams la'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i / mjug / phug dang phung po rnams la'o //

analyzed: gri ha khyim dang / ball'i dang // 'dzin khri 'dzin pa do shal la //

analyzed: gra ha nyi ma la sogs dang // 'ching ba nye bar chags pa dang // skra dang autya ma dang ni //

analyzed: 'dzin byed dga' byed la sogs dang // seng @237a * //

original: ge ma'i bu mun pa 'dzin //
analyzed: ge ma'i bu mun pa 'dzin //

analyzed: na h'a 'ching ba brtsegs pa dang // yangs pa glang po rkang pa tshigs //

original: spro ha to /
analyzed: spro ha to /

original: ge byang ba dang // sde tshan dang ni yangs pa la //
analyzed: ge byang ba dang // sde tshan dang ni yangs pa la //

analyzed: gsum sogs grangs la de bzhin no //

analyzed: mchu zheng dang ni glang po 'dul // nga rgyal dbye ba la yang 'gyur //

analyzed: aut+s'a ha ni spro ba dang // srad bu dang ni rgyud la yang //

translated: 9. The abhita is in the sense of

translated: The word tiras means demons, non-appearance, fatigue, obstruction, entire, and past.🔽 The word pura means supreme, first, own, place, first, and supreme.

original: bu rang sa na dang po mchog / pra tas snga nyin snga dro la //
analyzed: bu rang sa na dang po mchog / pra tas snga nyin snga dro la //
translated: The word prātaḥ means yesterday, morning, and before.

original: purbed++yus ni chos kyi gnas //
analyzed: purbed++yus ni chos kyi gnas //
translated: The word pūrva means the state of Dharma.

original: snga ma'i don dang kha nyin dang // phyi phyir dang ni yang dang yang //🔽mang ba'i don la mi tha ste //
analyzed: snga ma'i don dang kha nyin dang // phyi phyir dang ni yang dang yang // mang ba'i don la mi tha ste //
translated: The word pūrva means the meaning of the past, yesterday, later, again and again, and many times.

original: phan tshun dang ni 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun dang ni 'phrog pa'o //
translated: The word pūrva means mutual and to take away.

analyzed: pr'a dus rab gsal spyod pa dang // srid pa tsam la'ang blta ba'o // @241b sa nees /
translated: The word prātaḥ means the time of dawn, conduct, and to look even at mere existence.

original: dal bus rgyu bar bshad //
analyzed: dal bus rgyu bar bshad //
translated: The word śana means slowly and to move.

original: rang dbang dang ni legs mchod dang // nges pa'i don dang rjes su bgrod //
analyzed: rang dbang dang ni legs mchod dang // nges pa'i don dang rjes su bgrod //
translated: The word svātantrya means independence, excellent worship, definitive meaning, and to follow.

original: dka' tshegs dang ni yang dag 'byor //
analyzed: dka' tshegs dang ni yang dag 'byor //
translated: The word duṣkara means difficult and to be truly endowed.🔽 The word kāla means time, mere existence, nonsense, and sudden occurrence.🔽 The word kāla means time, mere existence, nonsense, and sudden occurrence.🔽 The word kāla means time, mere existence, nonsense, and sudden occurrence.🔽 The word kāla means time, mere existence, nonsense, and sudden occurrence.🔽 The word kāla means time, mere existence, nonsense, and sudden occurrence.🔽 The word kāla means time, mere existence, nonsense, and sudden occurrence.🔽 The word kāla means time, mere existence, nonsense, and sudden occurrence.

original: de dus tsam dang bab chol dang // glo bur byung ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de dus tsam dang bab chol dang // glo bur byung ba la yang ngo //
translated: The word kāla means time, mere existence, nonsense, and sudden occurrence.🔽 The word kāla

original: ma h'a mya ngan las skyes dang // ngan dang dug dang snying rje'i don //
analyzed: ma h'a mya ngan las skyes dang // ngan dang dug dang snying rje'i don //
translated: Ma is the great, the born of sorrow, the bad, the poison, and the meaning of compassion.

original: aa ho / 'dri dang rnam dpyod dang // rmad byung skyong ba rnams la 'dod //
analyzed: aa ho / 'dri dang rnam dpyod dang // rmad byung skyong ba rnams la 'dod //
translated: A ho is for the questions, the analysis, and the protection of the marvelous.

original: aa h'a h'a ni ngo mtshar skye //
analyzed: aa h'a h'a ni ngo mtshar skye //
translated: A ha ha is for the arising of wonder.

original: aa ha ha ni phra rgyas dang // yongs su nyon mongs rab dga' la //
analyzed: aa ha ha ni phra rgyas dang // yongs su nyon mongs rab dga' la //
translated: A ha ha is for the subtle development and the complete affliction.

original: a'a ha / skyong dang nges sbyor don //
analyzed: a'a ha / skyong dang nges sbyor don //
translated: A ha is for the protection and the definite application.

original: au t'a ho ni 'di dag rtog ;
analyzed: au t'a ho ni 'di dag rtog ;
translated: U ta ho is for these thoughts.

original: / sa ha'i sgra ni mtha' dag dang // cig car dang ni yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: / sa ha'i sgra ni mtha' dag dang // cig car dang ni yang dag sbyor //
translated: Sa ha is the sound for the entirety, the simultaneous, and the correct application.

original: 'dra dang yod dang 'brel pa la //
analyzed: 'dra dang yod dang 'brel pa la //
translated: In the same way, it is for the existence and the connection.

original: ha ni rkang pa kha skong dang // 'brel pa dang ni dman pa'o //
analyzed: ha ni rkang pa kha skong dang // 'brel pa dang ni dman pa'o //
translated: Ha is for the foot, the supplement, the connection, and the inferior.

original: h'a ni dug la sogs pa la //
analyzed: h'a ni dug la sogs pa la //
translated: Ha ha is for the poison and so forth.

original: h'a h'a skyo ba la rab grags //
analyzed: h'a h'a skyo ba la rab grags //
translated: Ha ha is well known for the sorrow.

original: dri za la yang //
analyzed: dri za la yang //
translated: It is also for the gandharva.

original: h'a h'a'o / he ni bye brag nges gzung dang // rkang pa kha skong dag la'o //
analyzed: h'a h'a'o / he ni bye brag nges gzung dang // rkang pa kha skong dag la'o //
translated: He is for the particular and the definite apprehension, and for the foot and the supplement.

original: h'i ni ngo mtshar dug sogs dang // dga' dang sdug bsngal rgyu rnams la'o //
analyzed: h'i ni ngo mtshar dug sogs dang // dga' dang sdug bsngal rgyu rnams la'o //
translated: Hi is for the wonder, the poison and so forth, and for the causes of joy and suffering.

original: h'i h'i ngo mtshar dgod pa la //
analyzed: h'i h'i ngo mtshar dgod pa la //
translated: Ha ha is laughter in wonder.

original: h'u h'a dga' dang dri za la //
analyzed: h'u h'a dga' dang dri za la //
translated: Ha hu is joy and Gandharva.

original: ha hee yong min dran pa dang // bod pa dang ni rgyu rnams la //
analyzed: ha hee yong min dran pa dang // bod pa dang ni rgyu rnams la //
translated: Ha he is not coming and remembering, and the vowels and consonants.

original: ho dang ho ni mtha' dag dang // bod pa dang ni 'gran par 'dod //
analyzed: ho dang ho ni mtha' dag dang // bod pa dang ni 'gran par 'dod //
translated: Ho and ho are all, and the vowels and consonants are desirous of competing.

original: mi kshva / myur dang nges pa'i don //
analyzed: mi kshva / myur dang nges pa'i don //
translated: Miskhva is swift and certain meaning.

original: de nyid la yang 'ga' zhig 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid la yang 'ga' zhig 'dod //
translated: Some also desire that.

original: mi zad pa don du ma can rnams so //
analyzed: mi zad pa don du ma can rnams so //
translated: The inexhaustible is multi-purposed.

original: bal po'i lo sum brgya brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa las /
analyzed: bal po'i lo sum brgya brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa las /
translated: In the three hundred and eighty-one year of the Nepalese calendar,

original: dbo'i zla ba'i nag pa'i tshes brgyad gza' phur bu'i nyin /
analyzed: dbo'i zla ba'i nag pa'i tshes brgyad gza' phur bu'i nyin /
translated: on the eighth day of the dark fortnight of the month of Pausa, Thursday,

original: dpal rol pa'i grong /
analyzed: dpal rol pa'i grong /
translated: in the glorious town of Rölpa,

original: goo ta ma lhag par gnas pa'i gtsug lag khang chen por /
analyzed: goo ta ma lhag par gnas pa'i gtsug lag khang chen por /
translated: in the great monastery of the Gotamavihāra,

original: pandi ta gnas brtan dpal rigs mchog dpal ye shes kyis 'drir bcug pa'i sde tshan rdzogs so /
analyzed: pandi ta gnas brtan dpal rigs mchog dpal ye shes kyis 'drir bcug pa'i sde tshan rdzogs so /
translated: the section was printed by the elder paṇḍita Śrī-Vajrācārya Śrī-Jñānaśrī.

original: // /'di ni lha dang mi yi yon gnas dam pa mtshungs med sprul sku rin po che zhva dmar bcod pan 'dzin pa bzhi pa /
analyzed: // /'di ni lha dang mi yi yon gnas dam pa mtshungs med sprul sku rin po che zhva dmar bcod pan 'dzin pa bzhi pa /
translated: This is the incomparable, sublime object of offering for gods and humans, the precious emanation body, the fourth Shabdrung of Zhechen Monastery.

original: dpal phag mo gru pa'i gdan sa rin po che thel gyi spyan snga rin po che'i zhal snga nas kyi bka' bzhin /
analyzed: dpal phag mo gru pa'i gdan sa rin po che thel gyi spyan snga rin po che'i zhal snga nas kyi bka' bzhin /
translated: In accordance with the words of the precious abbot of the precious seat of glorious Phakmo Dru,

original: zha lu lo ts'a ba dge slong dharma p'a la bha dra zhes bgyi bas /🔽snga 'gyur gyi 'chi @242a * //🔽med mdzod la sogs pa la brten nas bod skad la mi mkho ba'i rtags ngos 'dzin pa'i tshig la sogs pa bor //
analyzed: zha lu lo ts'a ba dge slong dharma p'a la bha dra zhes bgyi bas / snga 'gyur gyi 'chi @242a * // med mdzod la sogs pa la brten nas bod skad la mi mkho ba'i rtags ngos 'dzin pa'i tshig la sogs pa bor //
translated: the translator from Zhalu, the monk Dharma Pālabhadra,🔽based on the Immortal Treasury of the Early Translation School and so forth,🔽has removed words such as the identification of signs that are not necessary in Tibetan,

original: bshad gzhir rgya skad sor 'jog dgos pa dang / skad dod ma rnyed pa rnams sor bzhag ste bsgyur cing zhus te dag par bgyis pa'o /
analyzed: bshad gzhir rgya skad sor 'jog dgos pa dang / skad dod ma rnyed pa rnams sor bzhag ste bsgyur cing zhus te dag par bgyis pa'o /
translated: has left the Sanskrit as the basis for the explanations where necessary, and has translated and revised those for which no equivalent exists.
